Package jnet

Class Log

java.lang.Object
jnet.Log
public class Log extends Object
Utilities to handle logging and output. All messages logged with Log::stdlog are written to the file Log.STDLOG_FILE.

      Parameters:

      See Also:

    • format

      public static String format(int level, String location, String message)
      Generates a log message with specific formatting. This method does not print or write to any buffer. If level is out of bounds, the level will be omitted. This method will always generate a formatted output and will never result in error.

      The logging format is as follows:
      "LEVEL (LOCATION) MESSAGE"
      or
      "Log.format (LOCATION) MESSAGE"
      If the level was out of bounds.

      Parameters:
      level - the logging level of the message, which should be an integer in the interval [0, Log.levelToString.length].
      location - the location where the error occured (e.g. a class or method name).
      message - the error message.
      Returns:
      the formatted message.

    • stdout

      public static void stdout(int level, String location, String message)
      Formats and prints information to the standard output.
      Parameters:
      level - the verbosity level of the message.
      location - the location the message originated from.
      message - the message to print.
      See Also:
      • format(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • stdlog

      public static void stdlog(int level, String location, String message)
      Formats and writes information to the standard log file. The formatted message will also be printed by default if the logging level is greater than Log.INFO. This behavior can be overridden by calling Log.stdlog(int, String, String, boolean) with false for the last argument.
      Parameters:
      level - the verbosity level of the message.
      location - the location the message originated from.
      message - the message to print.
      See Also:
      • stdlog(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String,boolean)
      • format(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • stdlog

      public static void stdlog(int level, String location, String message, boolean print)
      Formats and writes information to the standard log file.
      Parameters:
      level - the verbosity level of the message.
      location - the location the message originated from.
      message - the message to print.
      print - whether to also print the formatted message to the standard output.
      See Also:
      • stdlog(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
      • format(int,java.lang.String,java.lang.String)
